passage_text: Thunderstruck is the first song on the 1990 AC/DC album The Razors Edge. The song peaked at number #5 on Billboard's Mainstream Rock Tracks. It was released as a single in Germany, Australia and Japan. Shown is the cover of the German release of the Thunderstruck single.

read more. Thunderstruck is the first song on the 1990 AC/DC album The Razors Edge. The song peaked at number #5 on Billboard's Mainstream Rock Tracks. It was released as a single in Germany, Australia and Japan. Shown is the cover of the German release of the Thunderstruck single.

The one-handed tapping technique can only be seen in the Thunderstruck music video. The song peaked at number No. 5 on U.S. Billboard's Mainstream Rock Tracks. It was released as a single in Germany, Australia and Japan.
The song T.N.T. by AC/DC was first released in Australia in December 1975, on the album T.N.T.. The song was later released as a single on March 1, 1976.

Thunderstruck is a song by AC/DC and one of the most famous AC/DC songs ever. It is best known for a main riff heard at the begining. Contrary to popular belief, Young does not play Thunderstruck's main riff with one hand.

Thunderstruck  is the lead single on the 1990 album The Razors Edge by the hard rock group AC/DC. The song was released as a single in Germany, Australia, and Japan, and peaked at No. 5 on U.S. the Billboard Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks. In 2010, Thunderstruck topped Triple M 's Ultimate 500 Rock Countdown in Melbourne, Australia.
